title: The names of islands and island settlements around New Georgia remained very imprecise well into the twentieth century. “New Georgia” in the broadest sense referred to a cluster of several large and many small islands located in the westcentral part of the Solomon archipelago. But “New Georgia” also signified the largest single island in that cluster. Confusingly, various navigational charts and travelers’ accounts sometimes referred to the latter as “Rubiana,” “Kusage,” or “Marovo” Island. There was no standard indigenous name for New Georgia. Two vast lagoons hug New Georgia island, the Marovo Lagoon on its east coast and the Roviana (Rubiana) Lagoon on its northwest coast
